intro: Tarenna crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tarenna crassifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments within humid forests. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species in the study of tropical flora.
